Detailed Description

Light System class.

This class provides a way of managing opengl lights, this class is provided for advanced users and is not recommended for average users, we suggest using phoenix::PhLightManager instead.

See also:
phoenix::PhVertexLight, phoenix::PhLightManager

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::PhVertexLightSystem (  ) 

Constructor.

Constructs a new light system. Usually you have no need to call this manually, as the render system makes one for you.

virtual phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::~PhVertexLightSystem (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

Deletes all the currents lights and closes the light system. Usually no need to call this manually.

Member Function Documentation

void phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::addLight ( PhVertexLight *  l  ) 

Add light.

Adds a light to the light system. Please note that if you add more lights than the current opengl implementation supports, you won't notice any difference.

Parameters:
l Pointer to the light to add.

void phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::clearLights (  ) 

Clear lights.

Deletes all the lights in the system.

void phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::removeLight ( PhVertexLight *  l  ) 

Remove light.

Removes a light from the light system.

Parameters:
l Pointer to the light to remove.

void phoenix::PhVertexLightSystem::setLights (  ) 

Set lights.

Updates the opengl state machine with all the current lights. There is usually no need to call this manually, the render system calls it automatically during PhRenderSystem::run().
